page.title: 01HASELOR AND AREA. WARWICKS.
page.content: Most of this block of land is agricultural land, mainly arable with some grassland and four areas of woodland. There is only one area of population of any size and that is in the village of Haselor. Haselor is a small village in Warwickshire situated about seven miles from Stratford-Upon -Avon and about three from Alcester. The private houses in Haselor are generally well sought after by middle class people commuting mainly to Birmingham, Redditch or Stratford for their work. There is a handful of council houses and some tied cottages/ houses. There is a wide variety of styles and ages among the houses. Our survey covers Daily Life at Home, School, Employment, Transport, The Post Office, Farming, Gamekeeping, Changes to Buildings.
